description: Learning tracks for the Software Engineering Graduate Program

tracks.name: Foundations Track
tracks.description: Build a solid foundation in computer science fundamentals, algorithms, data structures, and software design principles
target_audience: Career changers with no programming background
learning_objectives: Master fundamental programming concepts in Python
Understand time and space complexity analysis
Implement classic data structures (arrays, linked lists, trees, graphs)
Apply common algorithms for searching, sorting, and optimization
Write clean, maintainable code following best practices
Debug and test code effectively

tracks.name: Full Stack Development Track
tracks.description: Learn modern web development technologies and build production-ready applications using industry-standard tools
target_audience: Front-end developers wanting to learn back-end
prerequisites: Proficiency in at least one programming language
Understanding of algorithms and data structures
learning_objectives: Build responsive web applications with React
Create RESTful APIs with Node.js and Express
Design and implement PostgreSQL databases
Implement authentication and authorization
Deploy applications to cloud platforms
Write automated tests for front-end and back-end
Use Git for version control and collaboration

tracks.name: Advanced Specialization Track
tracks.description: Master cloud architecture, DevOps practices, microservices, and enterprise-scale system design
target_audience: Students who completed Full Stack Development Track
prerequisites: Experience building and deploying web applications
learning_objectives: Design scalable microservices architectures
Implement CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions
Deploy and manage applications with Docker and Kubernetes
Configure AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda)
Implement monitoring and logging solutions
Optimize application performance and security
Design for high availability and fault tolerance

tracks.name: Capstone Projects Track
tracks.description: Apply all learned skills to build real-world projects, create a professional portfolio, and prepare for job interviews
target_audience: All program participants preparing for job search
learning_objectives: Design and build a full-stack capstone project from scratch
Collaborate in teams using Agile methodologies
Present technical solutions to non-technical audiences
Prepare for technical interviews and coding challenges
Build a professional portfolio website
Network with industry professionals and alumni
Negotiate job offers and understand compensation packages
